headline: Product Manager at SOCAR Malaysia
summary:
I am enthusiastic about solving problems in various industry verticals through software. I love to envision a software product solving the simplest of day-to-day problems and nurture my vision till its completed. I am passionate about experimenting with different products having innovative user experiences, allowing organizations and individuals over the world gain a foothold in their matter of expertise. 

I'm very curious by nature. I always ask a lot of questions and often have my nose buried in books, newspapers, blogs or Wikipedia. 

I like getting people excited about the things that I'm excited about and acknowledging others is important to me. I tend to believe in the concept of intrinsic motivation, the idea that things are worth doing for their own sake, not because of some convoluted system of punishments and rewards.

I love meeting new people and learning new things, so please feel free to say hello and share your story with me.

Specialities: Product Management, Focus group & Market Research, Corporate Communications, Talent Management & People Skills, Marketing Strategies & Campaigns, Creative Team Leadership

headline: Global Industry Analyst, I study all aspects of HR, business leadership, corporate L&D, recruiting, and HR technology.
summary:
I am an industry analyst, researcher, educator, and technology analyst covering all aspects of corporate HR, training, talent management, recruiting, leadership, and workplace technology.

I was the founder of Bersin & Associates, which is now known as Bersin by Deloitte. I am a keynote speaker and advise HR teams and vendors in the HR space, and also serve as an educator, thought leader, and personal coach to HR and business leaders around the world.  

My professional goal is to make work life better around the world by helping HR professionals and teams learn, stay informed, and develop deep expertise on world-leading practices that help their companies.

I spend my time studying the world of work, HR, and all aspects of workplace technology. I advise vendors and large corporations on their products, HR and leadership strategies, and workplace technology solutions. And I am the Dean of the Josh Bersin Academy.

You can read more at http://www.joshbersin.com and https://bersinacademy.com

publications.name: Managing Talent Costs with Talent Analytics Technology
publications.description: The finance function could be missing an opportunity to use talent analytics technology to gain a stronger understanding of talent costs and needs, which is critical to planning and forecasting, according to findings from Deloitte’s third annual Global Human Capital Trends 2015: Leading in the New World of Work report.

publications.name: Global Human Capital Trends 2015: Leading in the new world of work
publications.description:
Global organizations today navigate a “new world of work”—one that requires a dramatic change in strategies for leadership, talent, and human resources. More than 3,300 organizations from 106 countries contributed to Deloitte’s Global Human Capital Trends 2015 survey, assessing the importance of specific talent challenges and their readiness to meet them.

This report explores 10 major trends that emerged from our research, which reflects four major themes for 2015: leading, engaging, reinventing, and reimagining. We present the capability gaps associated with each of these trends and offer practical insights to help you address these challenges in your organization. We also outline six key findings and invite you to interact with the Human Capital Trends Dashboard to explore the trends by geography, industry, and company size.

publications.name: Simply Irresistible: A New Model for Employee Engagement
publications.description: Employee engagement has become one of the most important challenges in business, yet with younger employees and a highly diverse global workforce, retention and engagement is a challenge. This article describes a new model for engagement, entitled Simply Irresistible.

publications.name: Deloitte Global Human Capital Trends 2014
publications.description: Largest ever study of global human capital trends, including assessment of challenges, capabilities, and detailed strategies among 2500 companies in 90 countries.

publications.name: The High-Impact Learning Organization: 2012 Research Program – The High-Impact Learning Organization Primer
publications.description: A brief restatement of what is meant by the phrase “high impact,” including the basic measures associated with effectiveness, efficiency and alignment. The newly revised Bersin & Associates Enterprise Learning Framework®, including the many associated process and organization design questions that high-impact learning organizations must master. An overview of the entire High-Impact Learning Organization Research Program and how best to use it.

publications.name: The Training Measurement Book
publications.description: The Training Measurement Book offers managers, executives, and training and human resource professionals a method for measuring their investments in a way that provides information that is both actionable, credible, and meaningful to corporate leaders. Using the methods outlined in this important resource, you can free yourself from traditional, often cumbersome measurement models and put in place pragmatic, useful, and easy-to-implement approaches for measuring training activities.

publications.name: The Blended Learning Book
publications.description: The Blended Learning Book is your user?s manual for implementing blended learning.? It gives you a guidebook to combining the latest technologies with traditional training models to create high-impact programs that drive superior business results (not just reduce costs). Filled with real-world examples and case studies from organizations such as Accenture, BI, Cisco, FedEx, Kinko?s, Grant-Thornton, IBM, Novell, the U.S. Navy, Verizon, and more, e-learning veteran Josh Bersin zeros in on What Works -- in all shapes and sizes of training departments from a variety of industries.

experiences.title: Software Engineer
experiences.description:
The projects involved testing
-	Telephony applications providing for retail banking facilities over telephone. 
-	Various branch applications utilized by the employees of the bank for servicing the customers.

Testing included system and regression testing the enhancements/developments to the existing retail banking. Enhancements would be either functional, for example, a new product is introduced, or non functional, for example, change in the workflow for loan processing. The application is a legacy system based on VB 6.0 and custom Far Point controls with interactions with many systems including Mainframe (DB2/AS400), SQL Server and UNIX flat files.  
The project also involved SOA testing with IBM Message Queue Server as a message broker. These were carried out on a release basis depending on the functional requirements. The responsibility for setting up the test infrastructure as well as executing the test cases for each release was completely undertaken by me.
Responsibilities 
	Involved in analyzing Business requirements/Design documents/Impact Assessment Documents. 
	Providing automation estimates for the release and identifying the risks.
	Resource management – Have led a team of 4 people in driving the automation initiative.
	Development of Test scenarios based on the design documents, Test conditions designing and reviewing Test Cases.
	Also functioning as a Test Automation Architect – feasibility analysis of the scripts to be automated, provide estimates for automation in the release
	Designed the Automation Framework and creation of Test Automation scripts
	Developed a specialized .Net program that controls the entire execution with enhanced reporting techniques. Has been used extensively by other projects also for overnight test execution resulting in reduced execution time
	Automation script result Analysis and defect report creation
	Development and maintenance of GH Tester scripts (Green Hat Tester) for SOA testing.

headline: Director of Strategic and Global Accounts at LPI. Passionate about the impact learning and development can have on business performance.

An experienced Account Director with over 20 years’ experience in the learning and development industry, passionate about the impact learning and development can have on business performance. Working as a trusted advisor to global and strategic customers, providing valuable industry insight and resources and supporting them to build the necessary capability to execute learning strategies and impact people and business performance.

Highly motivated, with a consultative approach to growing existing relationships and new business opportunities - both with UK and international customers. Excellent networking, interpersonal, communication and presentation skills

experiences.title: Director of Strategic and Global Accounts
experiences.description:
The Learning & Performance Institute (LPI) is the leading globally-active body for learning professionals in the workplace learning sector. Our unique focus is on ‘learning efficacy’; the demonstrable impact of learning on individual and organisational performance. 

With an innovative portfolio of membership, certification, accreditation, events, awards, networks and consulting, the LPI strives to be the best source of inspiration and information for learning professionals.

Key aspects of the role include:

Managing the Learning and Performance Institute’s global and strategic relationships, working 
closely with organisations as a trusted advisor to support them in providing excellence in learning.

Helping organisations build capability to execute learning strategies, supporting with digital transformation and developing learning pathways for learning professionals, subject matter experts and commercial roles. 

Supporting organisations to create well connected teams by providing access to valuable resource and curated content, industry insight, encouraging contacts to share best practice and collaborate and facilitating introductions.

Promoting excellence in learning, helping teams and organisations gain recognition of their achievements, encouraging speaking opportunities, thought leadership pieces and awards entries.

experiences.title: Business Development Manager
experiences.description:
An experienced Business Development Manager with over 15 years experience working with clients in the learning and development industry.

The Learning and Performance Institute (LPI) is a global Institute for Learning & Development professionals. Established in 1995 the Institute has grown on an annual basis to become the leading authority on Learning & Development.

Through an unrivalled range of membership, certification, accreditation, events and bespoke consultancy services, the Institute focuses on enhancing and recognising the skills and professional status of individuals and organisations engaged in learning activities, and assessing the quality of learning services.

The role involves working with clients across all sectors, understanding their needs, and advising how engaging with the LPI can benefit their organisation and improve performance.

Expertise:

•	Working with clients to help create professional development programmes for individuals delivering learning to internal and external clients, both face to face and live online
•	Helping clients to understand and utilise their LPI Accredited provider status, both to raise the profile and demonstrate the value of their service proposition to stake holders and potential clients
•	Working with global clients to help raise awareness of their services in the UK market

publications.name: Cloning Oracle Database RAC in Oracle Applications Release 12
publications.description: Manufacturing client bought a premium product Oracle Application R12 with Real Application Cluster (RAC) on Unbreakable 64-bit Linux to setup business continuity.  However I found this product is lacking in a RAC cloning component which gives ability to clone the product to another set of boxes. Without this functionality we cannot replicate our production or baseline RAC R12 instance to a Development or Test or Patch environment where we can develop, test or apply patches needed for our implementation cycle.

test_scores.name: Application Design for Web and Desktop by Nielsen Norman Group
test_scores.description:
GUI screen components, workflows, user types, design patterns, and ways of interacting with complex data

Designing applications for desktop and laptop computers poses special challenges: facilitating intricate tasks and workflows, enabling users to comprehend and manage complex data, and accommodating a rich variety of user roles, needs, and processes. Effective design and implementation of applications can have profound, positive implications on productivity, efficiency, accuracy, and satisfaction in a huge range of environments: creative studios, healthcare, home entertainment and productivity, manufacturing, call centers, supply-chain management, and many more.

test_scores.name: The Human Mind and Usability by Nielsen Norman Group
test_scores.description:
Apply psychology principles to predict and explain how your customers think and act

Behavior is strongly influenced by unconscious thought, but it is often more predictable than you might expect. Understanding the foundations of human cognition will help explain and anticipate user behavior.

test_scores.name: UX Basic  by Nielsen Norman Group
test_scores.description:
Be an effective UX professional: Know the lingo and sell the process

Focusing on user experience (UX) can differentiate a company from its competitors. In one day, we give you a thorough overview of the user experience field and its many components. You will learn the importance of a user-centered design process and the benefit of incorporating UX activities at every stage of a project.

My core areas of expertise are Server Refresh, Server Migrations, Datacenter Virtualization, Datacenter Consolidation, Technical Troubleshooting, Server Commissioning and Decommissioning, End User Computing, vSAN,Converged & Hyper-Converged Infrastructure, Operating System Support, Incident Management.

To bolster my credentials, I have earned numerous certifications such as ITIL Intermediate Certified into Service Operations, VMware Certified Advanced Professional, CISCO Certified, Microsoft Certified Professional, Oracle Cloud, AWS and Azure.

I am currently residing in Sydney, Australia and working for a Retail Giant Woolworths Group. Also I have done IT work in different countries like India, Malaysia, Singapore and Japan.

In my free time apart from keeping myself updated with the latest IT techs,  I like to spend my time with my little princess and love to relax on my lounge watching Netflix.

publications.description:
Red Hat Virtualization (RHV) is an enterprise virtualization product produced by Red Hat, based on the kernel-based virtual machine (KVM) hypervisor. Red Hat currently supports x86_64 architecture for Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) KVM. RHV repository includes the necessary KVM packages for IBM® POWER8® processor-based servers.

This article describes how to install and configure RHV components based on RHEL 7.3 LE, on an IBM POWER8 host.

publications.name: Implementing IBM Systems Director Active Energy Manager
publications.description:
Energy efficiency is a critical priority for IT managers because energy and power costs can be a significant portion of IT costs. Thus, understanding and investing in energy management is critical. With IBM® Systems Director Active Energy Manager™, an extension of IBM Systems Director, you can monitor and manage the power usage of systems. Originally designed to support IBM BladeCenter® and System x®, Active Energy Manager now supports the power management of additional IBM systems, including System z® mainframes and POWER6® processor-based systems, as well as storage devices using an intelligent Power Distribution Unit (PDU+).

Active Energy Manager helps determine the proper power allocation for each system in the data center. It can assist in determining how to allocate power to existing systems more efficiently so that additional systems can be accommodated without the need for additional power and cooling infrastructure. When power is constrained, the power management functions of Active Energy Manager allow power to be rationed on a system-by-system basis, enabling available processing power to match current workload closely.

This IBM Redbooks® publication can help system administrators effectively monitor and manage the power usage of systems in a data center. This book introduces energy management concepts and technologies, and then provides a step-by-step guide to implementing and using Active Energy Manager.
Table of contents

Chapter 1. Introducing IBM energy management
Chapter 2. Planning for Active Energy Manager
Chapter 3. Installing Active Energy Manager
Chapter 4. Navigating the IBM Systems Director Web console
Chapter 5. Getting started with Active Energy Manager
Chapter 6. Monitoring Active Energy Manager resources
Chapter 7. Managing Active Energy Manager resources
Chapter 8. Using a PDU with Active Energy Manager
Chapter 9. Using sensors with Active Energy Manager
Chapter 10. Integrating facility managers with Active Energy Manager

headline: Technical Trainer, Cloud Consultant&Principal Architect (Vmware Virtualization, Virtual Networking & Storage Technologies)
summary:
I am always fascinated by people - how they are different in so many ways and how similar they are. Consider me as a “Jack of All Trades!” kind of guy who takes real pleasure in trying to understand complex topics and how they have formed.  I love to explain to myself and others in a simpler way so that there is a greater understanding and appreciation for the topic and how these can apply to real-life implementations.

I've had a diverse career including entrepreneurship, building firms in partnerships and working for varying size corporations. Started my career as tech support engineer troubleshooting office automation equipment (coffee makers to computers, photocopiers to fax machines) in Bangalore. These skills helped me take on the role of a subject matter expert who assisted marketing teams with corporate demonstrations with the successful closing of deals. Subsequently, I started my own firm in Hyderabad that took end to end ownership of customer experience in office automation equipment (sales to service).  After growing the firm to a decent scale in early 2000, I switched my career to become an Consultant Architect / Technical instructor as I realized that I enjoyed learning and helping others learn new and complex topics. Over the last 18 years, I developed a unique teaching style which is greatly appreciated by my students & customers who are from diverse backgrounds. I have an exceptional ability to master new technologies and apply their full range of capabilities. As a professional speaker, I’m an outstanding communicator who is patient, personable, receptive and articulated.

I’m always looking for new technologies to learn and solve challenges, so if you've got a challenge you need a hand with, feel free to contact me directly.

" I Teach, So I Can learn "

publications.name: Designing An Automated Mobile Medical Resource Tracking System Application in Low Power, Resource Starved, Low Bandwidth Mobile/ Wireless Devices for serving the up-to-date Medical Information within a specific geographic region.
publications.description:
Twenty First Century is called an era of Technology.  It is the power of Mobile Computing technology that can be exploited to design such a flexible Mobile Application via thin client – server architecture for a remote server based system. This Application ensures its portability in any Mobile/Wireless devices having a mobile operating system ( Simbion, Windows CE , BREW , Linux  etc). 
Any Laptop, Hand held PDA, Cell Phone or any WAP enabled system can use the application at its fullest.

Potential Facilities Offered: 

•	Platform Independent:  The Application will run in any modern Mobile/Wireless devices available in the market irrespective of operating system applicable to them. 

NB.  Must meet require minimum hardware requirement , a potent mobile operating system ( Simbion, Windows CE , BREW , Linux  etc) , should have JAVA (Sun TM ) and WAP enabled plug-in.

•	Attractive and User Friendly User Interface (GUI):  As the Application architecture and design based on Tech Friendly JAVA Technology. Its GUI will be attractive and at the same time even a layman would be able to use this application.


•	Minimal Hardware Requirement:  The application design would be such that it needs minimum of hardware requirement. can run on low power , resource starved , low memory mobile devices. It would be very light weight application required low RAM.


•	Disconnection:  This Front End of the application is connected to remote server and the connection is established by high quality network like GPRS and GSM provided by Mobile Subscriber. So, less chance of disconnection. 


•	Device Supported Output: Server side of the Application generates device supported outputs using Framework design before publishing it in the server.
 
•	High End Relational Database: High End relational database like ORACLE stores, analyses complex table structure.

headline: Co-Founder & Country Head (Sales) at GharSeNaukri.com
summary:
Managing all India for an organization exclusively for the interest of women, I represent GharSeNaukri, a platform for all women who can contribute. 

Empowering women is the motto of GSN.......A Job Portal only for women.

GharSeNaukri is a platform to help all those women who want to strike a balance between career and family life , without compromising on any of her responsibilities. Our motive is to engage every women who can work from home matching her profile and interest. It caters to an underlying issue of Indian women not economically independent if she is a full-time homemaker. We provide women with desired strength to control their own lives, both within and outside their home and help them to make choices and transform those choices into desired outcomes. GSN help women achieve growth and career success on their own terms.

As work flexibility is becoming a part of today's generation, more and more opportunities are coming for working women. Companies not only save in terms of infrastructural costs but also grows in terms of increased productivity through our organization by connecting them with the right talent and talent with the right opportunities. Regardless of whether the company is looking for leaders, managers, or front line employees, we have the experience of varied domain, industry expertise, and depth of knowledge to find you the best and right talent.

projects.title: Deep Dance - Generating dance using Deep Learning
projects.description:
Using machine learning techniques like CNN, RNN and autoencoders created a
model to generate new dance videos. The new dance video will be of the same
style as the video the model is trained on. For simplicity, a silhouette dancing
video was used for training.

publications.name: DEEP DANCE (SHOWCASING THE CAPABILITIES OF RNN AND CNN ON A VIDEO DATASET)
publications.description:
Using a combination of Convolution Neural Network and Recurrent Neural Network to generate
new dance moves to showcase the capabilities of CNN and RNN on a video dataset. Simple
RNN used with combination of a CNN can be used to predict the next frame of video given few
frames of video. The technique used in this research/project can be used to extend an incomplete
video or to generate videos of similar type, given that the video is not very complex. This
research showcases a simple Machine Learning architecture that can be used to achieve some
interesting results on a simple video based dataset.

headline: People Consultant - People and Communities
summary:
“Give a good idea to a mediocre team, and they’ll find a way to screw it up. Give a mediocre idea to a good team, and they’ll find a way to make it better.” 
(Daniel Coyle, The Culture Code: The Secrets of Highly Successful Groups)

I am energized by understanding what goes on in teams and how we can create the best team experience a reality for all. Teams are the key ingredient for organisational success. Engagement lives on teams, we innovate on teams, customers experience our organisation through teams and our personal fulfilment and overall performance its generated through teams. It is imperative for organisations to get teams right but often the focus lands elsewhere. 

I hold a natural curiosity to explore the dynamics that oil the wheels of team interactions as what goes on between people really counts: Why do certain groups add up to be greater than the sum of their parts, while others add up to be less?

Building on 17 years of experience in the L&D Industry I have solid foundations in helping lift performance within organisations. I am currently working within Cisco’s People and Communities organisation dedicated to making more teams like the Cisco best teams. Cisco’s has been voted the #1 place in the world to work which is a reflection on the focus and investment we have made to unleash the Power of Teams. In my role as a Team Consultant, I consult with leaders to explore a team’s current state, validate reality through discovery techniques and intelligence, dream a new vision for the future and design and deliver team coaching engagements with the goal to identify and embed meaningful change. We take a strengths approach to our work driving understanding of the diversity and uniqueness of the individuals within each team knowing teams are well rounded because those within them are not. Research is at the core of what we deliver to generate the employee experience we all crave.

Passions: Team Coaching, Relationship Systems Intelligence (RSI), Emotional Intelligence, Team Dynamics, Social Connectedness, Design Thinking, Management, Leadership, Team Performance, Mindfulness, Cultural Awareness, Change Leadership, Training Needs Analysis (TNA), E-Learning, CBT Authoring, Training Management,  Learning and Development (L&D), Blended Learning, Winning Teams, Diversity,

TTN community provide a place for professionals in the same industry or with similar interests to share their insights and experiences, ask for guidance, and build valuable connections. TTN community is an association of software QA/testing enthusiasts, journeymen, masters and grandmasters who keep each other informed about innovations related to the software testing industry. 

Top 5 Reason to join TTN Community.
1. TTN community provide a -- place for professionals in the same industry or with similar interests to share content, find answers, post make contacts, and establish themselves as software testing industry experts.
2. TTN community promote a common platform where people can share their insights and develop an edge when it comes to the software testing industry.
3. Recognizing members and liking or commenting on the content they share
4. Linking your quality group discussions to your other social media channels(Facebook, Linkedin, WhatsApp) to encourage new voices and contributions to your discussions
5. Build your own connections and followers.
 
TTN community is not suitable for?
 
TTN community isn’t a place for businesses to blast advertisements—it’s a channel to share software testing content to those who will find it most valuable. This allows for not only higher engagement, but more quality interactions.


Being an active participant in a TTN community and Group can help you and your network with other professionals in your field, especially those outside of your immediate circle of current and present colleagues, classmates etc.

experiences.title: Member Of The Board Of Advisors
experiences.description:
RedLine13 is focused on bringing (Almost) Free Load Testing to the Cloud.  We were inspired by the high price of load testing tools or the lack of cloud-readiness of the free tools for load testing.

We provide a free and low fixed yearly cost for-pay service that helps you set up and deploy load testing instances in your Amazon account.  You have to pay for the load testing part of this on the spot instances – hence the (Almost).  

As an example: if you want to run a load test on 200 m1.small servers hitting your application or site, we can manage them as spot instances and it will cost you about $2.00 for an hour.  That should give you enough horsepower to emulate 50,000 users continuously providing load.  And we provide you with some pretty real-time graphs and reports when you are done. 

Almost Free means you can save $ and afford to test early and often. Easy means you can gift wrap load testing to make QA simple and repeatable.

The RedLine13 Team is led by co-founders Bob Bickel, Rich Friedman and Stephen Sigwart.

My core responsibilities will be :

1. Develop an understanding of the business, market and
industry trends in load testing
2.Provide wise counsel
3.Encourage and support the exploration of new business ideas
4. Act as a resource for executives
5. Enhancing the organisation’s reputation and credibility in the market place

Contact us at info@redline13.com OR visit https://redline13.com

experiences.title: Board Member at SQTAA
experiences.description:
►The trading name of “Software Quality & Testing Association Australia”, it’s initialization, “SQTAA” 

I am responsible for the day-to-day running of the Association, the processing of Membership Applications, the management of Payments and the delivery of services to Members.

► The Software Quality & Testing Association Australia (SQTAA) has been created to bring together industry professionals to further the practices, standards, and quality of software in a contemporary context.

► The Constitution of the association 👇

◉ It provides a professional environment in which resources – training, consulting, expert services and testing assets (white papers, articles, podcasts, webinars, etc.) – can be acquired based on referred businesses and individuals whom you know are trusted sources within the industry.

◉ The Association intends to provide a Quality and Testing community across Australia, providing a place for Quality and Testing professionals to meet, exchange ideas and experiences, learn, share and keep their approach current and practical. It will also provide support to new entrants into the industry through sponsored formal education opportunities.

◉ SQTAA provides an opportunity for Software Testing Tools and Services Vendors to exhibit their products to a wider targeted professional audience of decision-makers and influencers than has previously been possible. Members will have unique access to influence how these Tools and Services are designed and function to better suit the outcomes needed of the modern Software Quality Professional.

◉ IT recruitment agencies are also welcome to meet Quality and Testing professionals and to facilitate opportunities for exciting work for people dedicated to their profession.

Website is under construction. You can visit the link to register an interest and to subscribe to our updates.

http://sqtaa.online/

honors.title: Best Software Company in Gujarat
honors.description:
Gujarat Electronics & Software Industries Association (GESIA) recently organized its 6th Annual Awards Function at the YMCA Club on the 28th of June. This annual awards function is a highly prestigious event, and it acknowledges excellence in various realms of the ICT industry. This annual extravaganza draws the interest of the crème-de-la-crème of the industry, and this year was no different as various dignitaries graced the event with their presence.

Amidst the flurry of awards, KiwiQA managed to make its mark by being adjudicated as one of the three best software companies in the state of Gujarat. publications.name: Cache Locking Technique for Real-Time Embedded Systems
publications.description: Cache memory improves performance by reducing the speed gap between the CPU and the main memory. However, the execution time becomes unpredictable due to the cache's adaptive and dynamic behavior. Real-time applications are subject to operational deadlines and predictability is considered necessary to support them. Studies show that for embedded systems, cache locking helps determine the worst case execution time (WCET) and cache-related preemption delay. In this work, we evaluate predictability of an embedded system running real-time applications by instruction cache (I-Cache) locking. We implement an algorithm that locks the blocks that may cause more cache misses, using the Heptane simulation tool. We obtain CPU utilization measures for both cache analysis (no cache locking) and I-cache locking. Experimental results show that our proposed cache locking algorithm improves predictability and performance up to 15% locking, after that, predictability may be further enhanced by sacrificing performance.

publications.name: Predictability and Performance Enhancement for Real-Time Embedded Systems by Cache-Locking
publications.description:
In real-time systems, cache memory poses challenge to improve both predictability and performance because of its adaptive and dynamic behavior. Recent studies indicate that for application-specific embedded systems, static cache-locking helps determining the worst
case execution time (WCET) and cache-related preemption delay. In this work, we propose a static instruction cache locking algorithm that makes the real-time embedded system more predictable by locking the blocks that might cause more cache misses. We obtain CPU utilization for both static cache analysis (no cache-locking) and static cache-locking using Heptane. Experimental results show that our cache-locking algorithm may improve both predictability and performance of real-time systems.

publications.name: Quality Management and Agile/ Lean Transformation Case Study
Building Purposeful Scrum Teams via Awesome Backlog
Frustration Backlog – A Practitioner View
publications.publisher: Agile Deep Dive Conference - Agile Global Event by Knowledge Hut
publications.description:
Have you heard Agile failed? If so is it something wrong with Agile?. Is it Agile failed or we failed to understand agile values, principles and implement it right way.
Many organizations embrace the journey of Agile without having clear purpose and plan. Few common reasons stated for doing Agile(which we have heard as a coach / consultant):
•	“Let’s go Agile because everyone is doing Agile otherwise we are going to fail”
•	“Somehow we need to get it done”, 
•	“ It’s another methodology, what a big deal, lets adjust people, process and tools and rollout”, 
•	“ We need it to just showcase to clients that we have an Agile Framework”
These thoughts and approaches would result in Agilebut , Scrumbut, Agilelike, Agilefall, Kanbantype kind of implementations without paying much attention towards Agile Values and Principles. This results in building of painful “Frustration Backlog” which in turn leads to pool of practitioners who would say “ Why I Hate Agile”.
Is your organization / team going through similar phase / state?. What is that you/we can do to minimize this frustration backlog?
This session will highlight some of these frustrations and possible reasons / gaps in realizing values and principles. Idea is to do problem discovery exercise so that actions can be taken to reap maximum benefits of journey of Agile.

publications.name: PRODUCT QUALITY IMPROVEMENT VIA DEFINITION OF DONE AND TECH DEBT REDUCTION
publications.description:
Product quality plays a key strategic role in any organization success. Organizations have tried and
tested many tools, techniques, methodologies or mechanisms to achieve best possible quality while
trying to meet time to market demands. Agile methods have gained prominent attention of CXO as
a strategic piece for IT and Business alignment. Many organizations have embraced agile journey in
recent years and have reported noticeable improvement in product quality, customer satisfaction,
early value delivery (Time to market) and increased people engagement at workplace. One of the
magical factor driving product quality improvement in Agile Scrum is Definition of Done( DoD).
A well thought and implemented DoD would result in significant reduction of Tech Debt  and improvement of Product Quality.
This paper provides summary of our experience of implementation of DoD and magnificent results
we observed in an enterprise level large complex legacy system

publications.name: Sick and Tired? You don’t need a Physician: Try Personal Kanban
publications.description:
Idea of this session is to shed some light on power of Personal Kanban and real life examples to save from being Sick and Tired.
Kanban can be implemented in most walks of life. Knowingly or unknowingly few of us use it in few aspects of daily routine.
Conscious adaption of Kanban can help us to get rid of many situations like:
• Missed deadlines (Movie Ticket Booking, Restaurant booking for a candle night dinner..)
• Paying penalties (Tax pay, insurance renewal…)
• Missing meaningful milestones (Wedding Anniversary, Birthdays..)

Session  covered many such tools, techniques and examples to trigger thoughts among audience to identify and design a personal Kanban for their life..

publications.name: Agile Clinic – Strengthen Your Organization Agility
publications.description:
When a company thinks about transformation or a change from legacy traditional software development models to Agile, they first think of bringing in External coaches or Scrum experts. In another situation when the companies want to increase their maturity in agile, they still will want to hire people from outside who are experts in this arena. This discussion is all about how we could groom people internally to sustain and increase the credentials within the organization rather than relying always on external coaches.

Session would provoke thoughts among practitioners to design and deploy unique or customized approach to groom internal agile coaching talent.

Our 4S Model would help you setup your own Internal Agile Transformation Team 

This is tried and tested approach and also presented earlier and liked by many.

Protegrity focuses on securing the data itself – from acquisition to archive or deletion, and everywhere in between. experiences.title: Principal Consultant
experiences.description:
SR2 stands for Socially Responsible Recruitment, with a double bottom line that measures our contribution to society as well as our monthly turnover figures. We want to combine best practice in recruitment with customer service and integrity, honesty and transparency. 

When people ask us what we do, the easiest thing to say is ‘specialist IT recruitment’. Specifically contract and permanent hires across the UK, with a focus on digital transformation.

But that doesn’t really get to the heart of why we’re here.

We believe business is changing. Just look at Google, Ben & Jerry’s or Toms. Not only are they wildly successful on a financial level, they’re also ranked as some of the most socially responsible businesses around. Today it is those businesses pursuing social responsibility that are hitting the headlines, attracting the best talent and securing long term customer loyalty.

Recruitment can be a difficult process for businesses. At SR2 we do things a bit differently. For a start, we want to make the process as simple as possible for our clients. That’s why we’ll work with you to create a tailored solution to your recruitment needs, whether you’re looking for a one-off hire or want to create an entire campaign.

Part of our commitment to putting people first is being available to businesses to offer sound recruitment advice. If it turns out you don’t need to use the services of an agency, we’ll tell you. We’ll be happy to have shared our expertise and hopefully some day you’ll have a chance to recommend us to someone who does need our help.

Socially Responsible Recruitment isn’t just a clever way to help us stand out from the crowd. Putting people up there alongside profits is part of our DNA and we’ve committed to some pretty tangible promises in order to put that into action. 

Please see our website www.sr2rec.co.uk for more information on who we are and exactly what those promises are or feel free to give us a call on 0117 363 7407

publications.name: A decade of impact investing in India
publications.description:
Impact investments are those that create social or environmental impact and at the same time
Generate a financial return. While globally, impact investing or socially responsible finance has been growing and constantly gaining attention from academic as well as corporate circles, the industry is still at a nascent stage in India This paper presents a snapshot of growth of the impact investing industry in India over the last decade (2005-2015). It also presents potential ways for the industry to develop, taking into account the recent developments in India.

publications.name: Impact investments in India

projects.title: Odoo v8 to v13 CE Migration for The Netherland Based Client
projects.description:
The client is a sales oriented organization based in The Netherlands, Europe. It has operations in more than 25 countries across the globe. They are using Odoo v8 since many years with 25+ databases and now wish to migrate to Odoo v13 CE with almost 200+ custom modules and considering new updates as well managing 7 years of historical data to be migrated to v13. 

My role is to understand functionalities used in v8, guiding team on v13 migration and using out of box Odoo and OCA modules along with guiding QA to perform functional test and overall controlling the entire project as Project Coordinator.

projects.title: CityFurnish Odoo v13EE Implementation
projects.description:
CityFurnish is a 5 years old startup and became a leading company now to rent out Home Appliances and Furnishing in 7 Metro City in India.  CityFurnish is using a leading CRM and Accounting package. However they are not satisfied with their Warehouse management application hence decided to move to Odoo.

My role in this project was to collect requirement from key users which I performed traveling to their Office, interview every user and complete journey of current Sales and Purchase processed with rental management. Also visited their warehouse to understand operations very closely. Post that I prepared all the business requirement spec documents and submitted to the client. Post that planned the project activity for synchronization with CRM application for Sales and Purchase order management along with all Customer and Supplier master data as well current inventory level for each warehouse. My role is also to coordinate project updates, demonstration to client and managing change requests. I will be involved in final end user training also. Right now, we are in final phase of UAT and the application will go live before December 2020.

projects.title: RBSPL RingCenral VOIP Integration
projects.description:
RBSPL came again to implement RingCentral voip telephony integration with Odoo. We are the only one company who has built the RingCentral plugin with Odoo. We have implemented entire new API methodology to meet their needs and added new features in to user experience to met their need.

My role was to demonstrate the RingCentral app and understanding new requirements as well project coordinator to go live.

They were using Excel sheet to manage their chemical stencils BOM for different variants of products and planning their production. They were in search of EPR to ease their operations of procurement, sales, production planning and accounting.

My role in this project was an ERP consultant to work with a mediator company in Singapore to handle client requirements, project planning, getting customisation and development done from inhouse team as well rolling out demonstration to end client and end user trainings. We have least customise Odoo to met client need using Odoo v10CE for their production planning and procurement as well Make to Order to ease sales people life.

projects.title: MU Interior, SIngapore - Odoo v10 Community Edition Implementation

MU Interior is a popular interior designing company in Singapore. They were looking for an ERP to manage CRM, Sales Person activity, ease the sales person job to create quick quotation with all service level tasks and product level commercials. As well manage the entire project execution with outsourcing model, supplier invoicing, client project management with milestone wise payment and accounting.

My role was to collect requirement from the client where I went to Singapore to collect the detailed requirements and understood the user journey. I have prepared detailed project charter and proposal for the entire project. We have proposed v10 CE because client had a clear mind to use FREE version only with accounting, project management and timesheet management. We have customized quotation template, then project stage and UI and then project phases, planning and supplier management till invoicing.

The development effort was small but the user matrix and profiling of the access was the big job here. We have implemented right access and approval hierarchy with email update channel.

With Odoo v11CE, we have delivered complete ERP solution to manage their every department on ERP. We have delivered customised sales, purchase, inventory, production, workers payroll, biometric attendance with overtime, loan management, insurance management, container management, customised accounting for GST reports as well statutory report development for Export units.

projects.description:
Pickaride is working on the best concept for searching the nearest transportation medium, whether it be a self drive or individual driver or offering service by transportation companies. 

We at Attune studied client requirement and developed a complete search functionality considering the primary search through PINCODE and result will be fetch from the saved profile of driver's location pincode. Attune Infocom has written and optimized the code in Joomla of search to make it perfect to fetch the results in fastest speed. The search results are showing the whole address on integrated google map on screen and people can even drag the location pointer and locate it to their exact location. The search can run on a single parameter of PINCODE or can be extended with many parameters like, event, distance and transportation type. It also contains advance search option like, languages preferences, vehicle type, gender, amenities provided.

On other side, this whole system has loaded with JomSocial to add the social networking features to know the individual preferences. We have developed custom code in JomSocial to enable mobile text messages to inform about the nearest ride search and call back alerts. This system has extended its coverage by offering state wise ride coverage search option.

projects.title: Napster style Peer-to-Peer file sharing system
projects.description:
The project demonstrates Napster style file sharing. 

Server indexes the contents of all of the peers that register with it. It also provides the search facility with peers. A peer is both client and a server. As a client, it registers a file into indexing server and searches the file and list of peers which possess the file from indexing server. The user can pick one such peer and the client then connects to this peer and downloads the file. As a server, the peer sends the requested file when receiving a request.

The project consists of 
1) An Indexing server that keeps track of the files available and its locations and suggests mirror locations
2) Peer application that will connect to the indexing server for location of the files and also serves file from its local hard drive to other Peers
3) Both the Indexing server and File Sharing servers are build in Thread per client architecture and uses socket communication with TCP protocol 
4) The peers identifies the server using UDP broadcast messaging.

publications.name: A Green VNF-FG Embedding Algorithm.
A green VNFs placement and chaining algorithm
An efficient algorithm for virtual network function placement and chaining
ETSO: End-To-End SFC Orchestration Framework
NFV Orchestration Framework Addressing SFC Challenges
SFC Provisioning over NFV Enabled Clouds
A Scalable Algorithm for the Placement of Service Function Chains
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Network and Service Management
publications.description: Network Function Virtualization (NFV) decouples software implementations of network functions from their hosts (or hardware). NFV exposes a new set of entities, the virtualized network functions (VNFs). The VNFs can be chained with other VNFs and physical network functions (PNFs) to realize network services. This flexibility introduced by NFV allows service providers to respond in an agile manner to variable service demands and changing business goals. In this context, the efficient establishment of service chains and their placement becomes essential to reduce capital and operational expenses and gain in service agility. This paper addresses the placement aspect of these service chains by finding the best locations and hosts for the VNFs and to steer traffic across these functions while respecting user requirements and maximizing provider revenue. We propose a novel eigendecomposition based approach for the placement of virtual and physical network functions chains in networks and cloud environments. A heuristic based on a custom greedy algorithm is also presented to compare performance and assess the capability of the eigendecomposition approach. The performance of both algorithms is compared to a multi-stage based method from the state of the art that also addresses the chaining of network services. Performance evaluation results show that our matrix based method, eigendecomposition of adjacency matrices, has reduced complexity and convergence times that essentially depend only on the physical graph sizes. Our proposal also outperforms the related work in provider’s revenue and acceptance rate.

publications.name: Energy Efficient VM Scheduling for Cloud Data Centers: Exact Allocation and Migration Algorithms.
publications.description:
This paper presents two exact algorithms for energy
efficient  scheduling  of  virtual  machines  (VMs)  in  cloud  data
centers. Modeling of energy aware allocation and consolidation to
minimize overall energy consumption leads us to the combination
of an optimal allocation algorithm with a consolidation algorithm
relying on migration of VMs at service departures. The optimal
allocation  algorithm  is  solved  as  a  bin  packing  problem  with  a
minimum  power  consumption  objective.  It  is  compared  with  an
energy  aware  best  fit  algorithm.  The  exact  migration  algorithm
results  from  a  linear  and  integer  formulation  of  VM  migration
to  adapt  placement  when  resources  are  released.  The  proposed
migration  is  general  and  goes  beyond  the  current  state  of  the
art  by  minimizing  both  the  number  of  migrations  needed  for
consolidation and energy consumption in a single algorithm with
a  set  of  valid  inequalities  and  conditions.  Experimental  results
show  the  benefits  of  combining  the  allocation  and  migration
algorithms  and  demonstrate  their  ability  to  achieve  significant
energy   savings   while   maintaining   feasible   convergence   times
when  compared  with  the  best  fit  heuristic.

publications.name: Exact and Heuristic Graph-Coloring for Energy Efficient Advance Cloud Resource Reservation
publications.publisher: CLOUD '14 Proceedings of the 2014 IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing
publications.description: This paper presents a new graph-coloring model for advance resource reservation with minimum energy consumption in heterogeneous IaaS cloud data centers. We start with an exact integer linear programming (ILP) formulation which generalizes the graph coloring problem and follow with a fast Energy Efficient Graph Pre-coloring (EEGP) heuristic to address the scalability and to reduce convergence times. The results of performance evaluation and comparisons of EEGP with our exact algorithm and the Haizea advance reservation (AR) algorithm demonstrate the efficiency of EEGP for the energy efficient advance resource reservation problem. Our proposed EEGP heuristic is shown to perform very close to optimal, to scale well with problem size and to achieve convergence times close to the simple and fast AR algorithm that is however suboptimal.

publications.name: Cloud Computing Use Cases WhitePaper
publications.description: A white paper produced by the Cloud Computing Use Case Discussion Group

publications.name: Smart Metering the Clouds
publications.description: As cloud computing becomes increasingly pervasive, the data center energy consumption attributable to cloud computing is climbing, despite the clarion call of action to reduce consumption and reverse environmental effects. At the same time, the rising cost of energy - due to regulatory measures enforcing a "true cost" of energy coupled with finite natural resources rapidly diminishing, resulting in scarcity - is refocusing IT leaders on efficiency and total cost of ownership (TCO), particularly in the context of the world-wide financial crisis. We propose a "smart metering" approach that encompasses all the stakeholders in the cloud computing ecosystem to achieve these twin goals of "energy conservation" and "demand response". As such, this paper introduces our initial thoughts on "smart metering" and various implications and implementation ideas related to it.

publications.name: Global Software Development with Cloud Platforms
publications.publisher: SOFTWARE ENGINEERING APPROACHES FOR OFFSHORE AND OUTSOURCED DEVELOPMENT (SEAFOOD)
publications.description: Offshore and outsourced distributed software development models and processes are facing challenges, previously unknown, with respect to computing capacity, bandwidth, storage, security, complexity, reliability, and business uncertainty. Clouds promise to address these challenges by adopting recent advances in virtualization, parallel and distributed systems, utility computing, and software services. In this paper, we envision a cloud-based platform that addresses some of these core problems. We outline a generic cloud architecture, its design and our first implementation results for three cloud forms - a compute cloud, a storage cloud and a cloud-based software service- in the context of global distributed software development (GSD). Our ”compute cloud” provides computational services such as continuous code integration and a compile server farm, ”storage cloud” offers storage (block or file-based) services with an on-line virtual storage service, whereas the on-line virtual labs represent a useful cloud service. We note some of the use cases for clouds in GSD, the lessons learned with our prototypes and identify challenges that must be conquered before realizing the full business benefits. We believe that in the future, software practitioners will focus more on these cloud computing platforms and see clouds as a means to supporting a ecosystem of clients, developers and other key stakeholders.

publications.name: Modeling of Task Scheduling Algorithm Using Petri-Net in Cloud Computing
publications.description: Task scheduling is an NP-hard problem. In earlier, different task scheduling algorithms are proposed for cloud computing environment. By adapting new and modified task scheduling algorithms, better resource utilization can be obtained. In real time, most of the tasks are deadline-based tasks. The deadline-based task has different parameters. The backfilling algorithm is used to schedule these types of tasks in Haizea. In this paper, we modeled the existing backfilling algorithm for scheduling deadline-based task using Petri-Net. The paper presents the design model of the existing backfilling algorithm. The model specifies real-time challenges of backfilling algorithm using Petri-Net. The work also comes forward with some design issues of backfilling algorithm using Petri-Net.

projects.title: WebRTC[Media Resource Function supporting WebRTC in B2BUA]
projects.description:
WebRTC (http://www.webrtc.org) is a free, open project created by Google to enable web browsers with Real-Time Communication (RTC) capabilities via simple Javascript APIs and HTML5. 

GENBAND is providing an OTT (over-the-top) GW solution to service providers like Verizon to enable video interworking between clients in service provider domain and clients in OTT domain like Google, Skype and Facebook. Figure 1 and Figure 2 below describe the OTT GW architecture and use case at high level. The Radisys MS is used as transcoder and responsible for AV point-to-point transcoding. The GENBAND WAM (Web Application Manager) is acting as SIP-UA for WebRTC/HTML5 clients and communicating with Radisys MS in SIP interface.
